questions.answer: B. Archibald Campbell and Maha Min Hla Kyaw Htin

questions.question: As per Yandabo Treaty which of the following is correct?
options: A. Assam, Manipur, Arakan, were ceded to British
B. Burmese decided to allow diplomatic ambassadors from British
D. Both A and B are correct
questions.answer: D. Both A and B are correct

questions.question: When did the British annex Assam?

Which one is INCORRECT about the undivided Goalpara district?
options: A. The region came under the control of East India Company in the year 1765.
B. Under the East Indian Company rule, the area was under Rangpur Administration.
C. The area was renamed as 'North- Eastern Parts of Rangpur' before the Yandabo Treaty.
D. North Eastern Rangpur was constituted as Goalpara district in the year 1947.
questions.answer: D. North Eastern Rangpur was constituted as Goalpara district in the year 1947.

options: A. Bengali Language was imposed over Assamese as the British took over Assam.

questions.answer: A. Bengali Language was imposed over Assamese as the British took over Assam.

options: A. First tea garden was established in Assam in 1858.
B. Assam Tea Company began commercial production in 1858.
C. First Tea garden was established in Chabua, Dibrugarh.
questions.answer:
C. First Tea garden was established in Chabua, Dibrugarh
(First tea garden was established in 1837 and the Assam Tea Company began commercial production in 1840)

questions.answer: A. The Government of India Act 1858

questions.question: Who was the leader of the 1857 revolt in Assam?
Subedar Sheikh Bhikun and Subedar Nur Mahammad is known for:
options: A. Leading the Sepoy Mutiny in Assam
B. Joining the conspiracy to bring Kandarpeswar to the throne.
C. Revolting against the annexation of Sylhet to Chief Commissioner's province of Assam
questions.answer: B. Joining the conspiracy to bring Kandarpeswar to the throne.

questions.question: Who was popular among the people of Upper Assam as ‗Kalita Raja‘?
When was Maniram Dewan publicly hanged for his involvement in the rebellion against the British?
Who was hanged publicly with Maniram Dewan?
Which of the following was the CORRECT reason for hanging Maniram Dewan?
options: A. He was hanged because he was a leader of Sepoy-mutiny.
B. He was identified as the kingpin of the plot to bring Kandarpeswar to the throne.
C. He was the first India to grow tea commercially without British permission.
questions.answer: B. He was identified as the kingpin of the plot to bring Kandarpeswar to the throne.

questions.question: Which of the following is INCORRECT about Maniram Dewan
options: A. Maniram Dewan was the first person to establish tea gardens in Assam.
B. Maniram Dewan was a borbhandar (Prime Minister) of Purandar Singha.
C. Maniram Dewan was the only martyr in India who was hanged during the phase of sepoy mutiny.
D. Maniram Dewan was hanged by the British for conspiring against them during the 1857 uprising.
questions.answer: C. Maniram Dewan was the only martyr in India who was hanged during the phase of sepoy mutiny.
